definitions.sensetop: annoy somebodyit annoys somebody when…it annoys somebody to do something

examples.text: His constant joking was beginning to annoy her.
I’m sure she does it just to annoy me.
I only stay out late to annoy my parents.
It really annoys me when people forget to say thank you.
It annoys me to see him getting ahead of me.
examples.contextForm: it annoys somebody to do something

phrases: do something just to annoy somebody
do something only to annoy somebody

definitions.definition: to make somebody uncomfortable or unable to relax

examples.text: He swatted a fly that was annoying him.
The wasps were beginning to annoy me.

wordOrigin: Middle English (in the sense ‘be hateful to’): from Old French anoier (verb), anoi (noun), based on Latin in odio in the phrase mihi in odio est ‘it is hateful to me’.
